intro: [WRONG START] Eschscholzia californica, commonly known as the California poppy, is a herbaceous annual plant native to California. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and heart-shaped, lobed leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open fields and along roadsides. The California poppy is also the state flower of California and is known for its medicinal properties.
